item.title: Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land ‘Game System Overview’ trailer, 15 minutes of gameplay
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/atelier-yumia-the-alchemist-of-memories-the-envisioned-land-game-system-overview-trailer-15-minutes-of-gameplay

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

New footage ahead of Taipei Game Show 2025.

Publisher Koei Tecmo and developer Gust have released a new trailer for Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land introducing the game’s systems. Plus, around 15 minutes of new gameplay was showcased during the Taipei Game Show 2025 Special Program for the game.

Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on March 21 worldwide.

Watch the footage below.

Game System Overview Trailer

English

Japanese

Taipei Game Show 2025 Special Program

(Gameplay from 34:25 to 48:56.)

item.title: The Hundred Line: Last Defense Academy characters trailer – Hiruko, Tsubasa, Gaku, Kyoshika, Yugamu, and SIREI
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/the-hundred-line-last-defense-academy-characters-trailer-hiruko-tsubasa-gaku-kyoshika-yugamu-and-sirei

  • PC
  • Switch

The second batch of students.

Publisher Aniplex and developers Too Kyo Games and Media.Vision have released the second characters trailer for The Hundred Line: Last Defense Academy, introducing Hiruko Shizuhara, Tsubasa Kawana, Gaku Maruko, Kyoshika Magadori, Yugamu Omokage, and SIREI.

Here is an introduction to each character, via the game’s official website:

  • Hiruko Shizuhara (voiced by Marina Inoue) – Leader of the Special Defense Unit. A cold, almost heartless beauty, she always says what’s on her mind, even if it means offending others. She’s just as merciless on the battlefield, where she gets a twisted sense of pleasure from tearing invaders apart.
  • Tsubasa Kawana (voiced by Ayane Sakura) – A girl who knows a lot about machines and what makes them tick. She had a bright, lively personality, but isn’t good with stressful situations. When she gets nervous, she gets nauseous, and then…
  • Gaku Maruko (voiced by Kensho Ono) – A guy who’s true to his personal desires (to put it delicately). He’s a coward and always looking out for himself. However, there’s something so refreshingly honest about his pettiness that it’s hard to hate him. Gaku’s also good at taking care of other people once he opens his heart to them.
  • Kyoshika Magadori (voiced by Marina Inoue) – A young samurai who’s utterly clueless about the modern world. Has never even heard of multiplication tables, let alone learned them. She has a disturbingly close relationship with her katana, the Holy Jumonji Sword.
  • Yugamu Omokage (voiced by Daisuke Namikawa) – A boy who’s been in the business of killing since long before the war started. Unlike the rest of his family (who are also assassins, by the way), Yugamu believes that killing should be done with love. He enjoys torture and other immoral forms of pleasure.
  • SIREI (voiced by Otsuka Hochu) – The principal and commanding officer of Last Defense Academy. To put it another way, a weird little robot that orders the members of the Special Defense Unit around. Under his command, Takumi and the others will be working to wipe out the mysterious School Invaders.

The Hundred Line: Last Defense Academy is due out for Switch and PC via Steam on April 24 worldwide.

Watch the trailer below, as well a an archive of today’s second “Handler Transmission” broadcast.

Characters Trailer #2

Japanese

Handler Transmission #2

item.title: Technos The World: Kunio-kun & Arcade Collection announced for PS5, Switch, and PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/technos-the-world-kunio-kun-arcade-collection-announced-for-ps5-switch-and-pc

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch

Includes 12 rare titles from Technos Japan.

Arc System Works has announced Technos The World: Kunio-kun & Arcade Collection, a 12-game collection of rare Technos Japan titles for PlayStation 5, Switch, and PC, the latest issue of Weekly Famitsu reveals. It will launch on April 24 in Japan for 4,620 yen. First-print copies will include a soundtrack CD as a bonus.

The 12 titles included in the collection are as follows:

  • Super Dodge Ball (Arcade / NEOGEO)
  • Kunio-kun no Dodgeball da yo Zen’in Shuugou! (Super Famicom)
  • Shodai Nekketsu Kouha Kunio-kun (Super Famicom)
  • Downtown Nekketsu Baseball Monogatari: Yakyuu de Shoubu da! Kunio-kun (Super Famicom)
  • Kunio no Oden (Super Famicom)
  • Xain’d Sleena (Arcade)
  • China Gate (Arcade)
  • The Combatribes (Arcade)
  • The Combatribes (Super Famicom)
  • Shadow Force (Arcade)
  • Sugoro Quest++: DICENICS (Super Famicom)
  • DunQuest: Majin Fuuin no Densetsu (Super Famicom)

The collection also includes convenient features such as saving and loading, and bug fixes.

Thanks, Ryokutya2089.
